suggestions: 2. Ownership, Confidentiality and Non-use. No rights or licenses of any nature are implied or granted under this Agreement except as expressly provided herein, and, as between the Disclosing Party and the Receiving Party, all Confidential Information is and will remain the property of the Disclosing Party. The Receiving Party agrees to hold the Confidential Information in strict confidence as provided herein and to take all reasonable precautions to protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information. The Receiving Party agrees not to share, and to cause its Representatives (as defined below) not to share, the Confidential Information with any person or entity other than its directors, officers, employees, affiliates, advisors, legal counselors, consultants, financing sources, and agents who need to know such information for the purpose of assisting the Receiving Party in evaluating a Transaction (collectively, its “Representatives”). The Receiving Party agrees not to, and to cause its Representatives not to, make any use of the Confidential Information except solely to the extent required in its evaluation, negotiation and consummation of the potential Transaction. The Receiving Party will inform each Representative who is given access to Confidential Information of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information and cause each such Representative to preserve the confidentiality of such information in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. The Receiving Party shall be held responsible for any breach of the terms of this Agreement by its Representatives resulting from a breach of the Receiving Party’s duties with respect to its Representatives. For the avoidance of doubt, any affiliate that receives Confidential Information hereunder shall be bound by confidentiality obligations no less restrictive than those set forth in this Agreement, and the Receiving Party shall remain fully responsible for any breach of such obligations by its affiliates.

No rights or licenses of any nature are implied or granted under this Agreement except as expressly provided herein, and, as between the Disclosing Party and the Receiving Party, all Confidential Information is and will remain the property of the Disclosing Party. The Receiving Party agrees to hold the Confidential Information in strict confidence as provided herein and to take all reasonable precautions to protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information. The Receiving Party agrees not to share, and to cause its Representatives (as defined below) not to share, the Confidential Information with any person or entity other than its directors, officers, employees, advisors, legal counselors, consultants, financing sources, and agents who need to know such information for the purpose of assisting the Receiving Party in evaluating a Transaction (collectively, its “Representatives”). The Receiving Party agrees not to, and to cause its Representatives not to, make any use of the Confidential Information except solely to the extent required in its evaluation, negotiation and consummation of the potential Transaction. The Receiving Party will inform each Representative who is given access to Confidential Information of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information and cause each such Representative to preserve the confidentiality of such information in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. The Receiving Party shall be held responsible for any breach of the terms of this Agreement by its Representatives resulting from a breach of the Receiving Party’s duties with respect to its Representatives.
